summary:
People around you - friends, family, colleagues - are resources, but only if you engage with them! Let Netsheila support your students, company, municipality or initiative to access more resources.

I am founder and owner of Netsheila. My book, So You Think You Can’t Network, is available in English, Spanish and Dutch. We train people to build and use networks to develop their careers, their projects and to make their dreams a reality.

Clients include Gemeente Vlaardingen, Gemeente Zaanstad, Gemeente Leidschendam-Voorburg, Vellesan College, Friesland College, TRIAS vmbo, Saenredam College, the European Institute for Gender Equality, the European Parliament, FNV, Gemeente Zaanstad, Gemeente Vlaardingen, ING, HIRDA, Hivos, Openbaar Voortgezet Onderwijs Zaanstad, Particip, Workplace Pride, Wemos, WageIndicator Foundation. 

Recent speaking engagements include IABC (London and Washington), Star 100 (London), Professional Women's Network (Amsterdam) and events in Australia and the Netherlands to launch my book.
Netsheila is based in the Netherlands and is available for assignments in the USA, Australia and Europe. 
Specialties: 
• Workshops in developing connections as resources
• Gender in development
• Building communicative teams
• Co-writing tenders and grant proposals
• Conference and meeting facilitation

www.netsheila.com

projects.title: Grant writing and tenders
projects.description: More and more, organization that are passionate about dignity and respect for all people ask me to work with them on writing a grant proposal. I love doing it. I love getting into the heart of an organization, learning how they are making a difference and want to make even more of a difference, and writing that up in a way that a donor needs to read it. Tables, charts, diagrams, logic models, outputs, outcomes, assumptions - it is great puzzle to see how all these interact with the one thing that is most important in a grant proposal: the possibility that the world, in some way, works better for people once the grant has been implemented. And then, with the grant in hand, I love to work with the management of these projects, creating a team of leaders who implement the project and get results far beyond what they expected.

profile_positions.description:
At Netsheila, we know that you know people who can be a resource to you. We also know that people are shy or disinclined to let people know what they are up to and what they need. Take students, for example. If they don't make use of their networks, they can't have the work experience they want and in the end, have less chance of finding the jobs they would love to have. Organizations and projects miss out on resources that could otherwise be easily accessible. Lets get more resources into organizations by utilizing those we already have. In The Netherlands, in Europe, in the world.
Some of the companies we work for:
The Hague University, Perspektief, Femmes for Freedom, Nonviolent Initiative for Democracy, European Institute for Gender Equality, Hivos, Hirda, Wemos, European Parliament, Trias VMBO, Saenredam College, Vlaardingen municipality, Zaanstad municipality, Leidschendam-Voorburg municipality.
profile_positions.title: Chief Resource Officer - its all about abundance

profile_positions.description: ¿Piensas que no puedes trabajar en red? Si crees que es dificil ampliar tus conecciones, tienes el libro que necesitas. Cada uno de nosotros está conectado y esto es central en una red. Según Lin McDevitt-Pugh, crear una red va más allá que ir a reuniones sociales y empresariales. Se trata también de como se involucran y aprovechan los contactos ya existentes. En este libro, Lin te abrirá los ojos a la simplicidad de las redes a través de la teoría y de herramientas utiles para ejercitar tus habilidades. Descubre cómo convertir tus conexiones en un recurso para lograr tus objetivos tanto personales como empresariales. ¿Piensas que no puedes trabajar en red? está ricamente ilustrado con historias, muchas de ells son de personas que asistieron a sus talleres en África, Australia y Europa. "Una visión poderosa de lo que realmente es el trabajo en red: conectividad, honestidad, pasión y valor para hacer las cosas, porque nuestras ideas son importantes y son más grandes que nosotros mismos". - Kinga Jelinska, activista internacional de derechos reproductivos. ¿Para quién es este libro? ¿Piensas que no puedes trabajar en red? es para maestros, empresarios, universitarios recien graduados y personas con un corazón para la comunidad. Desarróllate profesionalmente y mejora las capacidades de tu equipo de trabajo. Haz realidad tus grandes ideas. Empieza hoy mismo!

profile_positions.description:
Wij komen ergens vandaan en daar hadden we onze netwerkstructuren. Mensen die we kenden van ons werk, onze studie, ons privéleven kenden, familievrienden, buren.  Mensen die wisten bij welke instantie je moest zijn als het ging om onderwijs, gezondheid, maatschappelijke ondersteuning. Structuren die zo vanzelfsprekend waren dat we niet precies weten hóe ze werkten, alleen dát ze werkten.

Die netwerken hebben nieuwkomers in uw stad niet. Zo ontbreekt er de belangrijkste schakel tussen het weten van wat ze nodig hebben en het krijgen van wat ze nodig hebben. 

Nieuwe netwerken komen niet vanzelf. De nieuwkomers hebben nooit ‘netwerken’ als vak geleerd. In deze nieuwe context moeten ze opnieuw hun netwerken samenstellen. 

Netsheila verzorgt al meer dan drie jaar netwerkles aan nieuwkomers. 
Hoe waarderen nieuwkomers deze lessen:
- Een Braziliaanse arts: "ik was sceptisch of ik hier waarde uit zou halen. Ik had het mis. Ik heb er zo veel aan gehad." 
- Een Syrische vluchteling: "Als ik deze cursus niet had gevolgd werkte ik nu niet als fotograaf".
- Een jonge vader uit Zuid Yemen die op de mbo zit: "Ik ging meteen raad vragen bij anderen over mijn studiekeuze."
- Een Filipijnse deelnemer: "Ik durfde mensen te groeten in de supermarkt. Ik voel me nu vrijer."
profile_positions.title: Trainer Participatie en Netwerken

volunteer_experiences.description:
In 2002 we set out to make visible the existence of US citizens and their same-sex, non US partners living in exile outside the US, simply because US law does not recognize our family relationship. We did that well and on 26 June 2013 the US immigration law changed. Personally this means I can now get a green card. Delighted to see our passion for justice honored. We now work with exiled lovers on repatriation. The Love Exiles Foundation was set up in 2004 and is registered as a Foundation in the Netherlands. Our vision is a fair world for all families. Love Exiles supports LGBT couples in exile or considering exile to be together, and works for equal rights for all families. A growing list of countries allow their citizens to sponsor their same-sex partner or spouse as legal immigrants, including Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Iceland, Israel, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Portugal, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, and the United Kingdom.In the other 150+ countries in the world, gay and lesbian citizens have no right to live legally together with their foreign partners. Committed partners are for all intents and purposes legal strangers.

Many same-sex couples choose to immigrate to a country that recognizes their relationship for immigration purposes. They face the challenges of leaving behind their homes, communities, families, aging parents, children, jobs and careers to start a new life.Love Exiles supports these families and educates the public about the issues same-sex couples face. There are Love Exiles groups in Germany,  the Netherlands, Spain, the United Kingdom, Canada and Australia. If you’d like more information, be part of a community or volunteer, contact us.
